016
017package org.parboiled.buffers;
018
019import org.parboiled.common.IntArrayStack;
020import org.parboiled.errors.ParserRuntimeException;
021import org.parboiled.support.Chars;
022import org.parboiled.support.IndexRange;
023import org.parboiled.support.Position;
024
025import java.util.Arrays;
026
027import static org.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkArgNotNull;
028import static org.parboiled.common.Preconditions.checkArgument;
029
030/**
031 * Immutable default implementation of an InputBuffer.
032 */
033public class DefaultInputBuffer implements InputBuffer {
034    private final int length;
035    private final char[] buffer;
036
037    // the indices of the newline characters in the buffer
038    // built lazily, since the newline information is normally only needed in the case of parse errors when
039    // error messages need to be generated
040    private int[] newlines;
041
042    /**
043     * Constructs a new DefaultInputBuffer wrapping the given char array.
044     * CAUTION: For performance reasons the given char array is not defensively copied.
045     *
046     * @param buffer the chars
047     */
048    public DefaultInputBuffer(char[] buffer) {
049        checkArgNotNull(buffer, "buffer");
050        this.buffer = buffer;
051        this.length = buffer.length;
052    }
053
054    public char charAt(int index) {
055        return 0 <= index && index < length ? buffer[index] :
056                index - length > 100000 ? throwParsingException() : Chars.EOI;
057    }
058
059    private char throwParsingException() {
060        throw new ParserRuntimeException("Parser read more than 100K chars beyond EOI, " +
061                "verify that your grammar does not consume EOI indefinitely!");
062    }
063
064    public boolean test(int index, char[] characters) {
065        int len = characters.length;
066        if (index < 0 || index > length - len) {
067            return false;
068        }
069        for (int i = 0; i < len; i++) {
070            if (buffer[index + i] != characters[i]) return false;
071        }
072        return true;
073    }
074
075    public String extract(int start, int end) {
076        if (start < 0) start = 0;
077        if (end >= length) end = length;
078        if (end <= start) return "";
079        return new String(buffer, start, end - start);
080    }
081
082    public String extract(IndexRange range) {
083        return new String(buffer, range.start, Math.min(range.end, length) - range.start);
084    }
085
086    public Position getPosition(int index) {
087        buildNewlines();
088        int line = getLine0(newlines, index);
089        int column = index - (line > 0 ? newlines[line - 1] : -1);
090        return new Position(line + 1, column);
091    }
092
093    public int getOriginalIndex(int index) {
094        return index;
095    }
096
097    // returns the zero based input line number the character with the given index is found in
098    private static int getLine0(int[] newlines, int index) {
099        int j = Arrays.binarySearch(newlines, index);
100        return j >= 0 ? j : -(j + 1);
101    }
102
103    public String extractLine(int lineNumber) {
104        buildNewlines();
105        checkArgument(0 < lineNumber && lineNumber <= newlines.length + 1);
106        int start = lineNumber > 1 ? newlines[lineNumber - 2] + 1 : 0;
107        int end = lineNumber <= newlines.length ? newlines[lineNumber - 1] : length;
108        if (charAt(end - 1) == '\r') end--;
109        return extract(start, end);
110    }
111
112    public int getLineCount() {
113        buildNewlines();
114        return newlines.length + 1;
115    }
116
117    private void buildNewlines() {
118        if (newlines == null) {
119            IntArrayStack newlines = new IntArrayStack();
120            for (int i = 0; i < length; i++) {
121                if (buffer[i] == '\n') {
122                    newlines.push(i);
123                }
124            }
125            this.newlines = new int[newlines.size()];
126            newlines.getElements(this.newlines, 0);
127        }
128    }
129}
130
